title: Diabetic Retinopathy
subtitle: CRUD for a medically focused company.
description: This CRUD was commissioned by a company whose objective is to analyze eye problems (searching for diabetic retinopathies) using AI and proprietary algorithms. My role was to develop the CRUD interface for two user roles: specialists and administrators. The former are responsible for diagnostics and improving the algorithm, while the latter manage users.

The application includes a login for session initiation, and two main sections: a patient section to register new patients, and a user section where administrators can create, edit, update permissions, and delete users.
The main technology used in this project was ReactJS. This choice was not mine, but rather a requirement from the client, who wanted to use a specific component suite—specifically Material UI.
In this project, I was subcontracted solely for the frontend implementation, so I did not work directly with the company receiving the application, but through a third party.
author: Brayan Téllez Cruz
objectives: Provide a visual platform for training and reviewing results from the AI algorithm.
Create a user management system with role-based access.
Offer a simple CRUD to add patients and view associated images.
